Material used.Description: HEK293 cells overexpressing wild-type or mutant DJ-1 (PARK7-L166P) were used.

Readout description.Result Description: Protein expression of mutant DJ-1 (L166P) was reduced by 60% compared to wild-type controls.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was analyzed in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type DJ-1 overexpression was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector-transfected cells were used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: t-test was used to compare mutant vs. wild-type expression levels.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Protein expression levels greater than 80% of wild-type controls.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Protein expression levels less than 50% of wild-type controls.

Material used.Description: HEK293 cells expressing wild-type or mutant DJ-1 were used for immunoprecipitation.

Readout description.Result Description: Mutant DJ-1 (L166P) showed reduced interaction with ubiquitin ligases compared to wild-type.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type DJ-1 immunoprecipitation was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: IgG control was used as a negative control.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Interaction with ubiquitin ligases observed in ≥80% of experiments.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Interaction with ubiquitin ligases observed in <50% of experiments.

Material used.Description: HEK293 cells expressing wild-type or mutant DJ-1 were used to measure mitochondrial complex activity.

Readout description.Result Description: Mutant DJ-1 (L166P) showed a 40% reduction in mitochondrial complex I activity compared to wild-type.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was analyzed in duplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type DJ-1 overexpression was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Cells without DJ-1 overexpression were used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA followed by post-hoc Tukey's test.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Mitochondrial complex I activity ≥80% of wild-type levels.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Mitochondrial complex I activity <50% of wild-type levels.
